column2: MISSISSIPPI DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: MS

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Which shape is a yield sign?
column6: Diamond

column2: 2. When you reach an intersection with stop signs at all four corners, you must yield the right-of-way to the driver:
column6: arrived before you.

column2: 3. When you back up:
column4: always look through the rear window.
column6: do it as fast as possible.
column8: you should rely only on your rearview mirror.

column2: 4. If your vehicle has a mechanical problem, you should:
column4: turn on your hazard lights and pull off the road.
column6: signal and pull into the slow lane.
column8: stop in your lane and put on your emergency flashers.

column2: 5. When entering an expressway from the entrance ramp, you should:
column4: go down to the bottom of the ramp and stop until it is safe to enter the expressway.
column6: use the acceleration lane to blend into the traffic.
column8: cross over to the traffic lane as soon as possible.

column2: 6. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: the right lane ends.
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 7. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column6: The light will soon change from green to red.

column2: 8. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 9. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.

column2: 10. To drive defensively, you must:
column6: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 11. The extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:
column4: the truck driver to stop the vehicle.
column6: other drivers when merging onto a freeway.
column8: other drivers when they want to pass the truck.

column2: 12. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column6: Vertical rectangle

column2: 13. The octagonal shape is used:
column6: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column8: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 14. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column6: look for a detour or another route.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.

column2: 15. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column6: green, yellow and red.

column2: 16. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column8: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column6: Bicycles have the right-of-way
column8: This lane is reserved for bicyclists

column2: 18. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: watch for this species crossing the road.
column6: park in the zoo area.
column8: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.

column2: 19. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column6: white; black

column2: 20. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column6: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

column2: 21. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 22. To see vehicles in your blind spots, you must look:
column6: in your outside rearview mirror.

column2: 23. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column6: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column8: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.

column2: 24. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column6: Open the side window so you can see.

column2: 25. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column6: tailgating.

column2: 26. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column6: The other driver.

column2: 27. To avoid panic stops, you should:
column4: pump your brakes to make sure they work.
column6: drive with your window down.
column8: scan the road ahead for hazards.

column2: 28. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 29. Before making a left turn from a one-way street, you must:
column4: be in the lane closest to the right curb.
column6: be in the lane closest to the center of the street.
column8: be in the lane closest to the left curb.

column2: 30. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
